headline: Twitter suspends fake accounts posing as Black Trump supporters
summary: Twitter has suspended a group of fake accounts pretending to be owned by Black supporters of President Donald Trump.

headline: Festivals of the future 'won't be limited by time and space,' Singapore arts CEO says
summary: Post-pandemic music and theater performances are likely to use a hybrid model, according to the chief executive of one of Singapore's largest arts centers.

summary: Amy Coney Barrett will face a second day of grilling from lawmakers on the Senate Judiciary Committee after fending off questions on Obamacare and abortion in a marathon session Tuesday.

headline: Fintech wins when bank stocks go down, Jim Cramer says
summary: "Whenever the bank stocks go down, we immediately get a massive amount of option-call buying in PayPal and Square," the "Mad Money" host said.

summary: Crossmark Global Investments’ Victoria Fernandez believes another round of stimulus is vital to the economic recovery.

headline: Cramer to investors: It's still too early to be speculating in the cruise line stocks
summary: "If you really want cruise exposure, I say be patient, because days like today make me think you'll get better buying opportunities," CNBC's Jim Cramer said Tuesday.

summary: Emma Pattee and Stefanie O’Connell Rodriguez, the cofounders of Statement, argue the personal finance industry needs a reset. It's time to move away from shaming clients and show them empathy instead.

Facebook said Tuesday it is launching a new global policy that bans ads that discourage people from getting vaccines. The company previously did have a policy against vaccine hoaxes that were publicly identified by global health organizations.
headline: Facebook says it will finally ban anti-vaccination ads
